com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step

Class StepOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step.StepOutput

  • public abstract class StepOutput
extends Object
    A base class that handles everything around the output of the step. This primarily includes defining the output columns (consisting of immutable source columns and user-defined columns) during initialisation, doing the main processing in execution, and getting the data for each user-defined column (source columns' data is handled automatically). 3rd Party Steps will extend this class to define their own output columns, do their own execution, and provide their own output data.

    • Constructor Summary

      StepOutput()

    • Constructor Detail

      • StepOutput

        public StepOutput()

    • Method Detail

      • baseInitialise

        public final void baseInitialise(org.json.JSONObject userOptions,
                                 List<StepOutput> inputs,
                                 BiFunction<String,String,List<Object>> getApertureObjectsByName,
                                 Supplier<Boolean> isInteractive,
                                 Consumer<Double> sendProgress,
                                 Function<String,String> translateText,
                                 Function<String,Cache> getCache,
                                 Function<String,Object> getServerProperty,
                                 BiFunction<String,String,List<String>> getServerObjects)
                          throws SDKException
        The baseInitialise function is called when the view is initialised. It stores the step inputs and extracts the step arguments into an array of values, then calls the overridable initialise function.
        Parameters:
        userOptions - A json object containing the user-defined step options, currently the values of the step arguments
        inputs - A list of input steps
        getApertureObjectsByName - A BiFunction callback into Aperture to get constant or glossary values
        isInteractive - A boolean to indicate whether the view is open as a drilldown (isInteractive = true) or not
        sendProgress - A Consumer callback into Aperture to set the progress of the execution progress
        translateText - A function to translate text keys into internationalised text (for internal use only)
        getCache - A function to get access to a global cache object for the current step
        getServerProperty - A function to get a server property by name
        getServerObjects - A function to get a list of values (as strings) for a particular property (i.e. "CONTENT") from a group of server objects (i.e. "DNSServers")
        Throws:
        SDKException - Throws if any exceptions occur

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
                throws SDKException
        The overridable initialise function is the first method to be called, and should perform any fast configuration required by the step. This is typically where output columns are defined.
        Throws:
        SDKException - Throws if any errors occur

      • getArgumentCount

        public final int getArgumentCount()
        Returns the number of argument values provided to the view.
        Returns:
        The number of arguments values provided.

      • getArgument

        public final String getArgument(int argumentIndex)
        Gets the value of the specified argument as a string. Arguments are the step-defined properties that are displayed in the UI and can be changed by the user.
        Parameters:
        argumentIndex - The index of the argument. Should not exceed the number of values in the list.
        Returns:
        The string value of the argument.

      • getInputCount

        public final int getInputCount()
        The number of inputs connected to the step. The maximum number is defined by the step definition, but the actual number connected is dependent on whether the user has connected inputs or not.
        Returns:
        A count of inputs connected to the step.

      • getInput

        public final StepOutput getInput(int position)
        Returns the input step at the position specified. If there is only one input, inputIndex should be 0.
        Parameters:
        position - The index of the input to be returned. Should not be higher than the number of inputs connected.
        Returns:
        The object representing the input step

      • baseExecute

        public final long baseExecute()
                       throws SDKException
        This method simply calls the overridable execute method and stores the rowCount for later use.
        Returns:
        The count of rows in the output dataset.
        Throws:
        SDKException - If any errors are encountered

      • execute

        public long execute()
             throws SDKException
        This overridable method will perform the processing required by the step, typically building an index or collecting output data. It must return the number of rows in the final output dataset.
        Returns:
        The final data row count
        Throws:
        SDKException - If any errors occur

      • getColumns

        public List<StepColumn> getColumns()
        This overridable method returns a list of columns that are output/provided by the step. It is recommended that 3rd Party developers use the column manager instead of overriding this method, but it is provided for power users.
        Returns:
        A list of column objects output by the step

      • getColumnManager

        public final ColumnManager getColumnManager()
        Returns the column manager that should be used for all column operations. By default it contains the columns in the connected inputs, but since most steps are added disconnected, it will typically contain no columns and will need to be populated by the step implementor.
        Returns:
        the column manager object.

      • getRowCount

        public long getRowCount()
        Gets the number of rows being output by the view. This is initially zero, only becoming correct after execute() is called. Is used to obtain the number of rows in input views. It is not required to be overridden by 3rd Party steps.
        Returns:
        The number of rows in the output dataset

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Returns the name of the data view. The name is displayed as the title of the drilldown.
        Returns:
        The step output name.

      • getInputColumn

        public final Optional<StepColumn> getInputColumn(int inputIdx,
                                                 String columnName)

      • getValueAt

        public abstract Object getValueAt(long row,
                                  int columnIndex)
                           throws SDKException
        Returns the value for a particular cell in the data view, indicated by the row and column indexes. This method will only be called for the columns that we have created. The row number will be from 0 to the rowCount returned by execute(). The column index will be 0 to the size of the output column list defined in initialise().
        Parameters:
        row - The row number required
        columnIndex - The index of the column required
        Returns:
        An object containing the data, should be String, Integer, Decimal, Long, Float, BigInteger, BigDecimal, Date, Boolean
        Throws:
        SDKException - Will throw if there is an error, and the error will appear in the cell as a red error value

      • getInputRow

        public final Object[] getInputRow(int inputIdx,
                                  long row)
                           throws SDKException
        The getInputRow function is a helper function that returns an array of value objects for a given row in the input data view, indicated by the row index and input index. The inputIdx value indicates which input to use when getting the row - if there is only one input it should be 0. The row number will be from 0 to the rowCount returned by execute().
        Parameters:
        inputIdx - The index of the input view - starts at 0
        row - The row number required - starts at 0
        Returns:
        An array of objects containing the data for each cell in the row
        Throws:
        SDKException - Will throw if there is an error

      • close

        public void close()
        Is called when the view is closed, and should be used to close resources held open for the life of the view.

      • getConstantByName

        public final Object getConstantByName(String name)
        Gets an Aperture Business Constant value by name.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the constant in standardised form i.e. 'EMAIL_ADDRESS'
        Returns:
        the value of the contstant or null if not found

      • getGlossaryValues

        public final List<Object> getGlossaryValues(String name)
        Get a list of values from the Aperture Glossary under the glossary item specified by name.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the glossary item in standardised form i.e. DNS_SERVERS
        Returns:
        a list of values of items under the glossary object

      • getServerProperty

        public final Object getServerProperty(String name)
        gets the value of a server property as defined in Aperture or set in the server.properties file
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the server property i.e. EmailValidation.cachePeriod
        Returns:
        - the value of the property, or null if not found

      • isInteractive

        public final boolean isInteractive()
        Gets whether the view is being opened in Interactive mode.
        Returns:
        - true if in a user-led drilldown, false if running as part of an export job

      • sendProgress

        public final void sendProgress(double progress)
        Send execution progress to Aperture.
        Parameters:
        progress - - should be 0 to 100.

      • translateText

        public final String translateText(String key)
        Translates a string key into translated text. Is for internal use only, as custom steps will not have access to Aperture string tables.
        Parameters:
        key - - The key of the string to translate
        Returns:
        - the translated displayable text

      • getCache

        public final Cache getCache(String name)
        Get the key/value cache object associated with the given name. Will create a new one if it doesn't exist or open an existing one for read/write access.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the cache
        Returns:
        - the cache object

      • getServerObjectProperties

        public final List<String> getServerObjectProperties(String objectType,
                                                    String propertyName)
        Gets the value of a given property from all server objects of a particular type.
        Parameters:
        objectType - The name of the server object - will search all instances of this object
        propertyName - The name of the property - will obtain and return the string value of the given property name's value from each object instance
        Returns:
        A list of strings containing the value of each of the objects contained within the server

      • setTranslateText

        public void setTranslateText(Function<String,String> translateText)
